page.title: 07THE EGG-WELL AT ASHENHURST
page.content: The egg-well is an isolated building found in the corner of a farmers field at Ashenhurst. It has undergone many redevelopments. Its name is derived from the eliptical shape of the well. The well has recently been covered with a form of shelter built from modern day housing bricks. A particularly interesting feature of the well is its surrounding stone plinth which has a Latin inscription chiselled into the rock meaning "Whatever of inward ailings may be yours a thousand such healing water cures".
